attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "what are the types of billing in bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/billing-and-enterprise-wallet-logic
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic
The system manages financial transactions through an internal Wallet system, supporting two distinct enterprise models.
hashtag
Centralized Billing Model
Concept:
The Parent Organization acts as the "Bank."
Logic:
All Child Branches share a single pool of funds.
Case:
Even if a Child Branch has no individual budget, it can perform transactions (like license upgrades) as long as the Parent Wallet has a balance.
hashtag
Decentralized Billing Model
Concept:
Each node is a "Siloed Entity."
Logic:
Every Branch must maintain its own", "[2] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[3] Title: Administration & Governance | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/administration-and-governance
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Administration & Governance
hashtag
RBAC & Permission Guardrails
The platform enforces strict
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
.
URL Protection:
If a Client User manually types an Admin-only URL (like
/admin/device-models
), the system returns a
403 Forbidden
error and logs the attempt.
Inheritance:
Custom roles can be created at the Parent level and pushed down to all Child Branches.
hashtag
Impersonation & Audit Trails
To assist with support and debugging, Admins have the ability to "Impersonate" users.
Security Protocol:
An Admin cannot change a client's pa", "[4] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt supports two types of billing models: Centralized Billing and Decentralized Billing. In the Centralized Billing Model, the Parent Organization acts as the bank, sharing a single pool of funds across all Child Branches. In the Decentralized Billing Model, each branch operates as an independent entity and must maintain its own budget for transactions [1].

## Key Details
- Centralized Billing allows Child Branches to perform transactions even without individual budgets, as long as the Parent Wallet has funds [1].
- Decentralized Billing requires each branch to manage its own funds independently, with no shared pool [1].

## References
[1] Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/billing-and-enterprise-wallet-logic"}

{system_prompt}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]
{user_question}

[[ ## snippets ## ]]

[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]

[[ ## completed ## ]]

Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.\nhashtag\nWelcome to the BOLT V2 docs\nYou’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.\nThis space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.\ncircle-info\nThese docs are written for operators and product owners first.\nIf you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.\nhashtag\nPick your path\nI’m new here\n→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.\nI’m running ops today\n→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions."]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Bolt supports two types of billing models: Centralized Billing and Decentralized Billing. In the Centralized Billing Model, the Parent Organization acts as the bank, sharing a single pool of funds across all Child Branches. In the Decentralized Billing Model, each branch operates as an independent entity and must maintain its own budget for transactions [1].

## Key Details
- Centralized Billing allows Child Branches to perform transactions even without individual budgets, as long as the Parent Wallet has funds [1].
- Decentralized Billing requires each branch to manage its own funds independently, with no shared pool [1].

## References
[1] Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/billing-and-enterprise-wallet-logic

[[ ## completed ## ]]"]

{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt supports two types of billing models: Centralized Billing and Decentralized Billing. In the Centralized Billing Model, the Parent Organization acts as the bank, sharing a single pool of funds across all Child Branches. In the Decentralized Billing Model, each branch operates as an independent entity and must maintain its own budget for transactions [1].

## Key Details
- Centralized Billing allows Child Branches to perform transactions even without individual budgets, as long as the Parent Wallet has funds [1].
- Decentralized Billing requires each branch to manage its own funds independently, with no shared pool [1].
